property.label: alwaysSessionAsync
property.name: alwaysSessionAsync
property.description: If this flag is set then a seperate thread is not used for dispatching messages for each Session in the Connection. However, a separate thread is always used if there is more than one session, or the session isn't in auto acknowledge or dups ok mode

property.label: alwaysSyncSend
property.name: alwaysSyncSend
property.description: Set true if always require messages to be sync sent

property.label: closeTimeout(单位：ms)
property.name: closeTimeout
property.description: Sets the timeout before a close is considered complete.

property.label: copyMessageOnSend
property.name: copyMessageOnSend
property.description: Should a JMS message be copied to a new JMS Message object as part of the send() method in JMS.

property.label: disableTimeStampsByDefault
property.name: disableTimeStampsByDefault
property.description: Sets whether or not timestamps on messages should be disabled or not.

property.label: dispatchAsync
property.name: dispatchAsync
property.description: Enables or disables the default setting of whether or not consumers have their messages dispatched synchronously or asynchronously by the broker.

property.label: objectMessageSerializationDefered
property.name: objectMessageSerializationDefered
property.description: When an object is set on an ObjectMessage, the JMS spec requires the object to be serialized by that set method.

property.label: optimizeAcknowledge
property.name: optimizeAcknowledge
property.description: optimizeAcknowledge

property.label: optimizedMessageDispatch
property.name: optimizedMessageDispatch
property.description: If this flag is set then an larger prefetch limit is used - only applicable for durable topic subscribers.

property.label: producerWindowSize
property.name: producerWindowSize
property.description: The ProducerWindowSize is the maximum number of bytes in memory that a producer will transmit to a broker before waiting for acknowledgement messages from the broker that it has accepted the previously sent messages. In other words, this how you configure the producer flow control window that is used for async sends where the client is responsible for managing memory usage. The default value of 0 means no flow control at the client. See also Producer Flow Control. This option only affects Openwire clients as Stomp does not have a means of notifying the clients of accepted messages asynchronously.

property.label: statsEnabled
property.name: statsEnabled
property.description: statsEnabled

property.label: useAsyncSend
property.name: useAsyncSend
property.description: Forces the use of Async Sends which adds a massive performance boost; but means that the send() method will return immediately whether the message has been sent or not which could lead to message loss.

property.label: useCompression
property.name: useCompression
property.description: Enables the use of compression of the message bodies

property.label: useRetroactiveConsumer
property.name: useRetroactiveConsumer
property.description: Sets whether or not retroactive consumers are enabled

property.label: watchTopicAdvisories
property.name: watchTopicAdvisories
property.description: Whether to use advisory messages

property.label: sendTimeout(单位：ms)
property.name: sendTimeout
property.description: Time to wait on Message Sends for a Response, default value of zero indicates to wait forever. Waiting forever allows the broker to have flow control over messages coming from this client if it is a fast producer or there is no consumer such that the broker would run out of memory if it did not slow down the producer. Does not affect Stomp clients as the sends are ack'd by the broker.

property.label: durableTopicPrefetch
property.name: durableTopicPrefetch
property.description: The maximum number of messages sent to a consumer on a durable topic until acknowledgements are received

property.label: inputStreamPrefetch
property.name: inputStreamPrefetch
property.description: The maximum number of messages sent to a consumer on a JMS stream until acknowledgements are received

property.label: maximumPendingMessageLimit
property.name: maximumPendingMessageLimit
property.description: Sets how many messages a broker will keep around, above the prefetch limit, for non-durable topics before starting to discard older messages

property.label: optimizeDurableTopicPrefetch
property.name: optimizeDurableTopicPrefetch
property.description: optimizeDurableTopicPrefetch

property.label: queueBrowserPrefetch
property.name: queueBrowserPrefetch
property.description: queueBrowserPrefetch

property.label: queuePrefetch
property.name: queuePrefetch
property.description: The maximum number of messages sent to a consumer on a queue until acknowledgements are received

property.label: topicPrefetch
property.name: topicPrefetch
property.description: The maximum number of messages sent to a consumer on a non-durable topic until acknowledgements are received

property.label: 消息冲突百分比
property.name: collisionAvoidancePercent
property.description: 避免消息冲突百分比，默认为15，也就是15%

property.label: 最大重发次数
property.name: maximumRedeliveries
property.description: 设置为-1时无限重发

property.label: 重发时间间隔
property.name: initialRedeliveryDelay
property.description: 毫秒

property.label: 是否启用冲突避免策略
property.name: useCollisionAvoidance

property.label: 消息重发递增延迟策略
property.name: useExponentialBackOff

property.label: 重连时间间隔
property.name: reconnectPolicy.initialReconnectDelay
property.description: 避免消息冲突百分比，默认为15，也就是15%

property.label: 最大重连时间间隔
property.name: reconnectPolicy.maxReconnectDelay
property.description: 设置为-1时无限重发

property.label: 是否启用指数延时机制
property.name: reconnectPolicy.useExponentialBackOff
property.description: 毫秒

property.label: 指数补偿机制中指数值
property.name: reconnectPolicy.reconnectDelayExponent
